info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 07 at 3:31PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Macon. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Nantahala River at Rainbow Springs has exceeded action stage, and minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. At 4 feet, the Nantahala River is flooding low-water crossings at Tate Cove Rd and near Water Gauge Rd and Rainbow Springs Rd and is beginning to strand residents or require lengthy detours into Clay County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 12 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area in the next three hours. This additional rain will result in further rises in stage height...so the river is unlikely to crest for several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nantahala River at Rainbow Springs. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
